Kelleigh_Bannen:
{{short description|American singer-songwriter}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Kelleigh Bannen | image = | image_size = | landscape = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = Kelleigh Carlyle Bannen | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1981|2|18}}{{cite book | title=Joel Whitburn's Top Country Singles 1944-2017 | publisher=Record Research, Inc. | author=Joel Whitburn | authorlink=Joel Whitburn | year=2017 | pages=36 | isbn=9780898202298}} | birth_place = [[Nashville, Tennessee]]{{cite web |url=http://www.kelleighbannen.com/story/news/kelleigh-bannen-signed-to-emi-records |title=Kelleigh Bannen Signed to EMI Records |publisher=Kelleighbannen.com |date= |accessdate=2012-10-28 |archive-url=https://archive.today/20130127123309/http://www.kelleighbannen.com/story/news/kelleigh-bannen-signed-to-emi-records |archive-date=2013-01-27 |url-status=dead }} | origin = [[Nashville, Tennessee]], U.S. | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer | label = Carlyle, [[EMI Records|EMI]] Nashville, Whiskey Rain | instrument = Vocals | years_active = 2008-present | background = solo_singer | website = https://www.kelleighbannen.com/ }} '''Kelleigh Carlyle Bannen''' (born February 18, 1981) is an American [[country music]] singer and host of Apple Music's Beats 1 "Today's Country" radio show. She debuted in 2012 with the single "Sorry on the Rocks", which has charted on [[Hot Country Songs]]. The song received three stars from Billy Dukes of Taste of Country, who compared her voice to [[Terri Clark]] but criticized the production.{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/kelleigh-bannen-sorry-on-the-rocks/ |title=Kelleigh Bannen, 'Sorry on the Rocks' – Song Review |publisher=Tasteofcountry.com |date=2012-08-01 |accessdate=2012-10-28}}{{cite web|url=http://www.musicrow.com/2012/08/musicrowpics-kelleigh-bannen-artist-visit/ |title=MusicRowPics: Kelleigh Bannen Artist Visit : MusicRow – Nashville's Music Industry Publication – News, Songs From Music City |publisher=Musicrow.com |date=2012-10-24 |accessdate=2012-10-28}} Her second single, "Famous", charted in 2014, followed by "You Are What You Love". Bannen's album, "Favorite Colors", was released in 2019, produced by Jaren Johnston. ==Family life== Kelleigh Carlyle Bannen was born February 18, 1981, in [[Nashville, Tennessee|Nashville]], [[Tennessee]]. When she was just 5 years old, she started playing the violin. Her first violin was made out of a [[Cracker Jack]] box and a paint stirrer. Her brother, Thomas Grant, died on her birthday in 2008 of a drug overdose.{{cite web|url=https://obits.tennessean.com/obituaries/tennessean/obituary.aspx?n=grant-thomas-bannen&pid=103777442 |title=Grant Thomas Bannen |publisher=TheTennessean |date=2008-02-19 |accessdate=2019-10-30}} Subsequent to that Kelleigh embarked on a memory tour benefiting the [[Hazelden Foundation]], which in 2014 merged with the [[Betty Ford Center]], to become the [[Hazelden Betty Ford Foundation]]. She also began advocating for [[Alcoholics Anonymous|AA]], and the [[National Council on Alcoholism and Drug Dependence]].{{cite web|url=https://www.thisnashvillelife.com/about |title=This Nashville Life with Kelleigh Bannen|publisher=Thisnashvillelife.com |date=2008-02-19 |accessdate=2019-10-30}} Kelleigh is the host of the [[podcast]] "This Nashville Life" alongside producer, Kevin Sokolnicki. On October 29, 2019, Kelleigh made her national television debut on the Today show with Hoda and Jenna.{{cite web|url= https://www.today.com/video/kelleigh-bannen-performs-time-machine-on-today-72246853728 |title=Kelleigh Bannen performs 'Time Machine' on TODAY |publisher= |date=2008-02-19 |accessdate=2019-10-30}} ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! style="width:12em;"| Title ! style="width:20em;"| Album details |- ! scope="row"| ''Radio Skies'' | * Release date: 2008 * Label: Carlyle * Format: [[compact disc|CD]] |- ! scope="row"| ''Cheap Sunglasses'' | * Release date: 2016 * Label: Whiskey Rain * Format: [[compact disc|CD]] |- ! scope="row"| ''The Joneses'' | * Release date: 2018 * Label: Whiskey Rain * Format: Digital |- !scope="row"|''Favorite Colors'' | * Release date: 2019 * Label: Whiskey Rain * Format: Digital |- !'''''Christmas Is Coming''''' | * Release date: 2020 * Label: Whiskey Rain * Format: Digital |} ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:14em;"| Single ! colspan="2"| Peak chart
